2a9ad3a773ec.title: Ours is a culture dominated by the ego’, but which is only one part of the larger “self’, that also…

content.subtitle: In strategic terms, think of the ego as your ‘command and control‘ center, with meditation filtering out the ‘static’ and ‘interference’.

virtuals.subtitle: In strategic terms, think of the ego as your ‘command and control‘ center, with meditation filtering out the ‘static’ and ‘interference’.

paragraphs.text: Ours is a culture dominated by the ego’, but which is only one part of the larger “self’, that also includes our unconscious, childhood ‘programming’, the autonomic and limbic systems, and scores of neurotransmitters that affect our behavior without our even knowing it. So even just on a ‘practical’ level, meditation helps to calm the “ego” center…
paragraphs.name: bb6f

content.subtitle: Imagine a group of people playing Monopoly. They are obsessed. They rejoice when they pass Go and collect $200. They despair when they have…

virtuals.subtitle: Imagine a group of people playing Monopoly. They are obsessed. They rejoice when they pass Go and collect $200. They despair when they have…

paragraphs.text: Imagine a group of people playing Monopoly. They are obsessed. They rejoice when they pass Go and collect $200. They despair when they have to pay rent. They are anxious when its their turn to roll the dice, they hope when they land on Chance, they breath a sigh of relief when they land on Free Parking.
paragraphs.name: b525

d5ff1346fc9a.title: I see meditation as a way to trascend life.

paragraphs.text: I see meditation as a way to trascend life. It is a wisdom path. But maybe because of the latter is not for everyone. Yes, I think is more for people with a mystical sense of life. From that point of view it makes more sense. Meditation without a purpose. As life itself is. Because what is the purpose of life?
paragraphs.name: a72e

341a8ab9552d.title: I agree very much with what you wrote and the clear-eyed way you wrote it.

paragraphs.text: I agree very much with what you wrote and the clear-eyed way you wrote it. And I would also wish to be daring here and use the G-word. Why not meditate to just to get acquainted with God. ‘Cause you ain’t gonna find It anywhere else. You know, cut out the religious, ceremonial middle-man and seek the original Bad Ass.

1b16beae358b.title: I can’t repeat it enough to all my friends: yes, meditation delivers plenty of results.

content.subtitle: Your relation with the outcomes of meditation is like that with a butterfly: the more you chase it, the more it goes away from you — look…

virtuals.subtitle: Your relation with the outcomes of meditation is like that with a butterfly: the more you chase it, the more it goes away from you — look…

paragraphs.text: I can’t repeat it enough to all my friends: yes, meditation delivers plenty of results. But, unlike mostly anything else we learn in this place, time, society, and cultural environment we live in, is that the irony of it is: “don’t do it because of the results — don’t chase any goals. Do it just for the sake of doing it. No expectations. Breath…
paragraphs.name: 5fe3

15fd8ee130e2.title: Fantastic historical synopsis here Charlie, I appreciated this piece a lot.

content.subtitle: I was first introduced to Zen philosophy through Alan Watts, but after reading Philip Kapleau I realized how little attention Watts paid to…

virtuals.subtitle: I was first introduced to Zen philosophy through Alan Watts, but after reading Philip Kapleau I realized how little attention Watts paid to…

paragraphs.text: Fantastic historical synopsis here Charlie, I appreciated this piece a lot. I wanted to find a line to highlight, but really the whole writing succinctly and precisely sums up the major flaws in how Westerners have viewed mediation as a means to an end, as though we always need to be achieving something.

1d23693db0091f2d3c0484afd6acfc81.title: Why You Should Meditate For No Reason

b936685a127b38919ced9dee97effd1e.title: Why You Should Meditate For No Reason

paragraphs.text: I saw another article this morning titled something like “How Meditation Makes You More Bad-Ass”. It was written in the usual sort of saccharine aspirational ‘hell yeah!’ rhetoric that sometimes makes me feel embarrassed to be a millennial. I’ve spent almost ten years now reading about meditation alongside actually practicing, and I’d like to clear the air a bit about what meditation is and why you shouldn’t be misled by things like this.
paragraphs.name: ddcc
